description: First attested in the late 14th century as Middle English abstinent, abstynent, from Old French abstinent, from Latin abstinēns, present participle of abstineō. See abstain.

adjectives.description: abstinent (comparative more abstinent, superlative most abstinent)

entries.meaning: Refraining from indulgence, especially from the indulgence of appetite. [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
One who abstains; a faster. [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
(usually capitalized, religion, historical) One of a sect who appeared in France and Spain in the 3rd century, and believed in abstinence from meat and sex.
